channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- SEOPress
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- SEOPress

item.title: CVE-2023-6290|2024-08-02T08:28:21.380Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.3 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when unfiltered_html is disallowed

item.title: CVE-2023-1669|2024-08-02T05:57:24.871Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 6.5.0.3 unserializes user input provided via the settings, which could allow high-privilege users such as admin to perform PHP Object Injection when a suitable gadget is present.

item.title: CVE-2024-5488|2024-08-01T21:11:12.790Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.9 does not properly protect some of its REST API routes, which combined with another Object Injection vulnerability can allow unauthenticated attackers to unserialize malicious gadget chains, compromising the site if a suitable chain is present.

item.title: CVE-2024-5488|2024-07-10T20:02:36.599Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.9 does not properly protect some of its REST API routes, which combined with another Object Injection vulnerability can allow unauthenticated attackers to unserialize malicious gadget chains, compromising the site if a suitable chain is present.

item.title: CVE-2024-4900|2024-07-02T20:25:03.092Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.8 does not validate and escape one of its Post settings, which could allow contributor and above role to perform Open redirect attacks against any user viewing a malicious post

item.title: CVE-2024-4899|2024-06-24T06:00:01.586Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.8 does not sanitise and escape some of its Post settings, which could allow high privilege users such as contributor to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

item.title: CVE-2024-4900|2024-06-24T06:00:01.863Z -- unknown -- seopress
item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.8 does not validate and escape one of its Post settings, which could allow contributor and above role to perform Open redirect attacks against any user viewing a malicious post

item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.8 does not sanitise and escape some of its Post settings, which could allow high privilege users such as contributor to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.9 does not properly protect some of its REST API routes, which combined with another Object Injection vulnerability can allow unauthenticated attackers to unserialize malicious gadget chains, compromising the site if a suitable chain is present.

item.description: The SEOPress WordPress plugin before 7.8 does not sanitise and escape some of its Post settings, which could allow high privilege users such as contributor to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks.
